pr_title: [FLINK-20478][table-planner-blink] Adjust the explain result for blink planner

timeline.message: [FLINK-20478][table-planner-blink] ExecNodePlanDumper only displays the attributes of ExecNode
[FLINK-20478][table-planner-blink] ExecNodePlanDumper only displays the attributes of ExecNode
[FLINK-20478][table-planner-blink] ExecNodePlanDumper only displays the attributes of ExecNode
[FLINK-20478][table-planner-blink] ExecNodePlanDumper only displays the attributes of ExecNode
[FLINK-20478][table-planner-blink] ExecNodePlanDumper only displays the attributes of ExecNode
[FLINK-20478][table-planner-blink] ExecNodePlanDumper only displays the attributes of ExecNode
[FLINK-20478][table-planner-blink] Normalize the plan printing: print arithmetic operators, comparison operators and AND/OR operator as the infix style, and print other operators as the prefix style

timeline.bodyText: I think it is a dag not tree?
timeline.author: wenlong88

replies.bodyText: if there is only one sink (root) node, it's a rooted tree, see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tree_(graph_theory)#Rooted_tree
replies.author: godfreyhe

timeline.bodyText: just wonder that why the result doesn't contain 2 tree starting from sink but three trees? IMO, treeToString and dagToString can be unified and it maybe easier to understand for user if the plan starts from sink.
timeline.author: wenlong88

The following tree of {@link ExecNode} + * 

{@code
+	 *        Sink
+	 *         |
+	 *        Join
+	 *      /      \
+	 *  Filter1  Filter2
+	 *     \     /
+	 *    Project1
+	 *       |
+	 *     Scan
+	 * }
+ * + * would be converted to the tree style as following: + * 
{@code
+	 * Sink
+	 * +- Join
+	 *    :- Filter1
+	 *    :  +- Project1(reuse_id=[1])
+	 *    :     +- Scan
+	 *    +- Filter2
+	 *       +- Reused(reference_id=[1])
+	 * }
+	 * }
+ */ + public static String treeToString(ExecNode node) { + return treeToString(node, new ArrayList<>(), false); + } + + /** + * Converts an {@link ExecNode} tree to a string as a tree style. + * + * @param node the ExecNode to convert + * @param borders node sets that stop visit when meet them + * @param includingBorders Whether print the border nodes + * @return the plan of ExecNode + */ + public static String treeToString(ExecNode node, List> borders, boolean includingBorders) { + checkNotNull(node, "node should not be null."); + // convert to mutable list + List> borderList = new ArrayList<>(checkNotNull(borders, "borders should not be null.")); + TreeReuseInfo reuseInfo = new TreeReuseInfo(node, borderList); + return doConvertTreeToString(node, reuseInfo, true, borderList, includingBorders); + } + + /** + * Converts an {@link ExecNode} DAG to a string as a tree style. + * + * @param nodes the ExecNodes to convert + * @return the plan of ExecNode + * + *

The following DAG of {@link ExecNode} + * 

{@code
+	 *     Sink1    Sink2
+	 *      |        |
+	 *   Filter3  Filter4
+	 *       \     /
+	 *        Join
+	 *      /      \
+	 *  Filter1  Filter2
+	 *     \     /
+	 *    Project1
+	 *       |
+	 *     Scan
+	 * }
+ * + * would be converted to the tree style as following: + * 
{@code

replies.bodyText: how to display the reused (common) plan ? If  the result of the example just contains two trees, each tree will display all nodes from sink to source.
replies.author: godfreyhe

timeline.message:
[FLINK-20478][table-planner-blink] Normalize the plan printing: print arithmetic operators, comparison operators and AND/OR operator as the infix style, and print other operators as the prefix style

This closes #14315

[FLINK-20478][table-planner-blink] Normalize the plan printing: print arithmetic operators, comparison operators and AND/OR operator as the infix style, and print other operators as the prefix style

This closes #14315

[FLINK-20478][table-planner-blink] Adjust the explain result for blink planner

This closes #14315

[hotfix] BatchExecRank#explainTerms should use `RelWriter#input` instead of `RelWriter#item` for input rel

This closes #14315

[FLINK-20478][table-planner-blink] ExecNodePlanDumper only displays the attributes of ExecNode

This closes #14315

[FLINK-20478][table-planner-blink] Normalize ExecNode's description: print arithmetic operators, comparison operators and AND/OR operator as the infix style, and print other operators as the prefix style

This closes #14315

[FLINK-20478][table-planner-blink] Normalize ExecNode's description: print arithmetic operators, comparison operators and AND/OR operator as the infix style, and print other operators as the prefix style

This closes #14315
